text:
Dear Mr.
On behalf of the National Association of Educational
Broadcasters, I wish to thank you for your cooperation
In our endeavor to offer to all member stations the best
in tape recorded programs. It is unfortunate that not
all programs submitted can be selected for network
distribution. As only a limited number can bo chosen,
every effort is made to accept only those that are out¬
standing. I regret that the Network Acceptance Committee
voted against the acceptance of your proposed series
checked reasons:
for the following
Not for network use—program material localized
Could be presented as well by local stations
Repeats material already presented by netv/ork
Material or presentation not stimulating
Recording quality not satisfactory
Poorly organized
It is feared that series would lack listener interest
. Voice quality dull
Neither educational nor informative
Not for an adult audience
Nothing original, unique, or different
Poor script
Acting amateurish
Obviously read
Timing bad—more or less than 29.29 or 15.29
Eie tape oubmitted oust be representative of the'aeriee, not an introduotbn
The committee sincerely hopes that you will submit
other programs with better success.
Your master tapes are being returned by headquarters
under separate cover.
Cordially yours.
Waldo Abbot, Chairman
Network Acceptance Committee
NA3B
